The headline of the claim: The expert's verdict mentions that the claim had an apocalyptic headline that stated "Black Panthers Just Took Over City (Atlanta) – All Out War On Election Day." This headline is the first aspect that was employed to verify the authenticity of the claim.
Confirmation from the Atlanta Police Dep: The expert's verdict includes a statement from the Atlanta Police Department's public affairs director, Carlos Campos, who confirmed that there was no unrest or need for a police response at any polling places in Atlanta on that day. This confirmation helps verify the inauthenticity of the claim.
Explanation of the actual event: The expert's verdict explains that the claim's headline is a dressed-up take on a demonstration that occurred over the weekend. The Atlanta chapter of the New Black Panther Party held an "armed rally against voter suppression" in Atlanta's West End neighborhood. This clarification provides a factual context for the claim.
Political affiliations and responses: The expert's verdict mentions that the New Black Panther Party posted photos of the rally on their Facebook page, along with a disclaimer that they were not working with any campaign. It also highlights the response from both Brian Kemp, the Republican candidate, and Abrams campaign spokeswoman Abigail Collazo. These political affiliations and responses add further evidence to evaluate the authenticity of the claim.
